article.title: whisper
article.p:
whisper
, speech in which the vocal cords are held rigid, preventing the vibration that produces normal sounds. In whispering, voiceless sounds are produced as usual; but voiced sounds (
e.g.,
vowels) are produced by forcing air through a narrow glottal opening formed by holding the vocal cords rigid and close together.
See also
voice
;
vocal fry
.
